title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others‚Äô private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement Niccol√≤ Salvini. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla‚Äôs code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: How to calculate indicators with `coresoi`
text: Let‚Äôs say interested calculating indicator say number 2, need load data sample mock_data_core supply related variables function ind_2(). Check documentation function ind_2() get grasp . output ind_2 schema shows
code: data("mock_data_core", package = "coresoi")  ind_2(   data = mock_data_core,   contract_value = importo_complessivo_gara,   publication_date = data_pubblicazione,   stat_unit = provincia,   test_type = "ks",   emergency_name = "coronavirus" ) |>   head(10) #> # A tibble: 10 √ó 12 #>    indicator_id indica‚Ä¶¬π indic‚Ä¶¬≤ aggre‚Ä¶¬≥ aggre‚Ä¶‚Å¥ aggre‚Ä¶‚Åµ emerg‚Ä¶‚Å∂ emerg‚Ä¶‚Å∑ count‚Ä¶‚Å∏ #>           <dbl> <chr>      <dbl> <fct>   <chr>   <chr>     <int> <chr>   <chr>   #>  1            2 Awarded‚Ä¶   0.039 AGRIGE‚Ä¶ ISTAT1  provin‚Ä¶       1 Corona‚Ä¶ 1       #>  2            2 Awarded‚Ä¶   0.946 ALESSA‚Ä¶ ISTAT1  provin‚Ä¶       1 Corona‚Ä¶ 1       #>  3            2 Awarded‚Ä¶   0.586 ANCONA  ISTAT1  provin‚Ä¶       1 Corona‚Ä¶ 1       #>  4            2 Awarded‚Ä¶   0.368 AREZZO  ISTAT1  provin‚Ä¶       1 Corona‚Ä¶ 1       #>  5            2 Awarded‚Ä¶   1     ASCOLI‚Ä¶ ISTAT1  provin‚Ä¶       1 Corona‚Ä¶ 1       #>  6            2 Awarded‚Ä¶   0.943 ASTI    ISTAT1  provin‚Ä¶       1 Corona‚Ä¶ 1       #>  7            2 Awarded‚Ä¶   0.857 AVELLI‚Ä¶ ISTAT1  provin‚Ä¶       1 Corona‚Ä¶ 1       #>  8            2 Awarded‚Ä¶   1     BARI    ISTAT1  provin‚Ä¶       1 Corona‚Ä¶ 1       #>  9            2 Awarded‚Ä¶   0.226 BARLET‚Ä¶ ISTAT1  provin‚Ä¶       1 Corona‚Ä¶ 1       #> 10            2 Awarded‚Ä¶   0.88  BELLUNO ISTAT1  provin‚Ä¶       1 Corona‚Ä¶ 1       #> # ‚Ä¶ with 3 more variables: country_name <chr>, indicator_last_update <dttm>, #> #   data_last_update <dttm>, and abbreviated variable names ¬π‚Äãindicator_name, #> #   ¬≤‚Äãindicator_value, ¬≥‚Äãaggregation_name, ‚Å¥‚Äãaggregation_id, ‚Åµ‚Äãaggregation_type, #> #   ‚Å∂‚Äãemergency_id, ‚Å∑‚Äãemergency_name, ‚Å∏‚Äãcountry_id

title: Try `coresoi` with you own data
text: beginning make sure correctly installed package coreosoi. compute indicator ind_1, need map function argument column project partner‚Äôs database. code snippet, load project partner‚Äôs data using read.csv function. call ind_1 function, passing data, publication_date, emergency_name, test_type, stat_unit arguments. map arguments columns project partner‚Äôs database, need ensure partner data column named stat_unit, companies win tenders, column named publication_date. order correctly map data (.e.¬†columns emplyed calculations) data (.e.¬†columns going pass indicators functions) please refer sample data documentation goes columns specs.
code: library(coresoi)  # Load project partner data partner_data <- read.csv("path/to/partner/data.csv")  # calculate the ind_1 indicator ind_1_result <- ind_1(data = partner_data,                        publication_date = <column_rooting_to_publication_date> ,                        emergency_name = "Coronavirus",                       test_type = "fisher",                       stat_unit = <column_rooting_to_company_winners> )

title: Try `coresoi` with you own data
text: Integrating coresoi package project partner data requires mapping function argument column partner‚Äôs database. computing ind_1 indicator, need two columns: stat_unit, companies win tenders publication_date. following template can integrate indicators available coresoi.

title: Measuring Corruption Risk in Emergency
text: goal coresoi provide sandbox environment researchers anti-corruption analysts interact indicators ‚Äôve designed. also offer mock data extracted dati.anticorruzione aid analysis. hope platform facilitate effective efforts corruption promote greater transparency government.

title: Measuring Corruption Risk in Emergency
text: can install development version coresoi GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("CORE-forge/coresoi")

what: Example: Compute Winning rate across the crisis indicator
title: Measuring Corruption Risk in Emergency
text: certain cases, may necessary calculate Indicator 1, primarily focuses companies awarded public contracts significantly higher rate outbreak Emergency (case, Coronavirus) . Indicator 1 uses Fisher‚Äôs exact (test choices include Barnard z-test) test compare proportions pre- post-Emergency contracts determine statistically significant difference two groups. resulting indicator follows schema (convenient ship frontends) generated using coresoi::generate_indicator_schema function.
code: library(coresoi) #> Warning in citation(pkgname): no date field in DESCRIPTION file of package #> 'coresoi' #> Warning in citation(pkgname): could not determine year for 'coresoi' from #> package DESCRIPTION file #> To cite package 'coresoi' in publications use: #>  #>   Salvini N, DelSarto S, Cantone G (????). _coresoi: Measuring #>   Corruption Risk in Emergency_. R package version 0.1.1, #>   <https://core-forge.github.io/coresoi/>. #>  #> A BibTeX entry for LaTeX users is #>  #>   @Manual{, #>     title = {coresoi: Measuring Corruption Risk in Emergency}, #>     author = {Niccolo Salvini and Simone DelSarto and Giulio Cantone}, #>     note = {R package version 0.1.1}, #>     url = {https://core-forge.github.io/coresoi/}, #>   } library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union  ## basic example code with ind_1() i.e. High Winning Rate ind_1_res <- ind_1(   data = mock_data_core,    publication_date = data_pubblicazione,    stat_unit = cf_amministrazione_appaltante,   emergency_name = "coronavirus",   test_type = "fisher") ind_1_res #> # A tibble: 624 √ó 12 #> # Rowwise:  #>    indicator_id indica‚Ä¶¬π indic‚Ä¶¬≤ aggre‚Ä¶¬≥ aggre‚Ä¶‚Å¥ aggre‚Ä¶‚Åµ emerg‚Ä¶‚Å∂ emerg‚Ä¶‚Å∑ count‚Ä¶‚Å∏ #>           <dbl> <chr>      <dbl> <chr>   <chr>   <chr>     <int> <chr>   <chr>   #>  1            1 Winning‚Ä¶       1 000585‚Ä¶ ISTAT1  cf_amm‚Ä¶       1 Corona‚Ä¶ 1       #>  2            1 Winning‚Ä¶       1 000647‚Ä¶ ISTAT1  cf_amm‚Ä¶       1 Corona‚Ä¶ 1       #>  3            1 Winning‚Ä¶       1 000675‚Ä¶ ISTAT1  cf_amm‚Ä¶       1 Corona‚Ä¶ 1       #>  4            1 Winning‚Ä¶       1 000759‚Ä¶ ISTAT1  cf_amm‚Ä¶       1 Corona‚Ä¶ 1       #>  5            1 Winning‚Ä¶       1 000802‚Ä¶ ISTAT1  cf_amm‚Ä¶       1 Corona‚Ä¶ 1       #>  6            1 Winning‚Ä¶       1 000808‚Ä¶ ISTAT1  cf_amm‚Ä¶       1 Corona‚Ä¶ 1       #>  7            1 Winning‚Ä¶       1 000982‚Ä¶ ISTAT1  cf_amm‚Ä¶       1 Corona‚Ä¶ 1       #>  8            1 Winning‚Ä¶       1 001043‚Ä¶ ISTAT1  cf_amm‚Ä¶       1 Corona‚Ä¶ 1       #>  9            1 Winning‚Ä¶       1 001086‚Ä¶ ISTAT1  cf_amm‚Ä¶       1 Corona‚Ä¶ 1       #> 10            1 Winning‚Ä¶       1 001107‚Ä¶ ISTAT1  cf_amm‚Ä¶       1 Corona‚Ä¶ 1       #> # ‚Ä¶ with 614 more rows, 3 more variables: country_name <chr>, #> #   indicator_last_update <dttm>, data_last_update <dttm>, and abbreviated #> #   variable names ¬π‚Äãindicator_name, ¬≤‚Äãindicator_value, ¬≥‚Äãaggregation_name, #> #   ‚Å¥‚Äãaggregation_id, ‚Åµ‚Äãaggregation_type, ‚Å∂‚Äãemergency_id, ‚Å∑‚Äãemergency_name, #> #   ‚Å∏‚Äãcountry_id

title: Measuring Corruption Risk in Emergency
text: coresoi part project CO.R.E.- Corruption risk indicators emergency, financed EU Commission, part Internal Police Security Fund (ISF-P) program, project presented Department Political Sciences leader coordination Prof.¬†Gnaldi (PI) funded total 514 thousand euros. working group made colleagues Prof.¬†Enrico Carloni, Prof.¬†Marco Mazzoni, Prof.¬†Benedetto Ponti, Prof.¬†Maria Giovanna Ranalli. international network involves Universitat Obierta Catalunya (Spain), Dublin City University (Ireland), Oficina Antifrau de Catalunya (Spain), Infonodes (Italy), Transparency International (Portugal), Villa Montesca Foundation (Italy). C.R.E. focuses assessing risk corruption public procurement preventive perspective. view achieving goal, central European agenda, CO.R.E. therefore intends develop validate procedure constructing synthetic indicator risk corruption emergency period can usefully used national anti-corruption agencies, media citizens accountability purposes.

title: BDNCP open data from ANAC ‚Äî mock_data_core
code: mock_data_core

title: BDNCP open data from ANAC ‚Äî mock_data_core
text: data frame 7,240 rows 60 columns: cig, cig_accordo_quadro Tender Identification Code, code assigned Authority uniquely track tenders contracts nationwide assigned Lot level. numero_gara, number identifying tender; tender consists one lots, identified CIG oggetto_gara Subject Tender - description goods services procured importo_complessivo_gara Overall Amount Tender n_lotti_componenti Number lots make contract oggetto_lotto Subject Lot importo_lotto Lot amount oggetto_principale_contratto Main object contract (Works, Services Supplies) stato cig life cycle status settore indicates whether Contracting Authority operates ordinary sectors (EU Directive 24 applies) Special Sectors (EU Directive 25 applies) luogo_istat ISTAT Localization provincia Province abbreviation data_pubblicazione date publication notice data_scadenza_offerta Deadline submission bid cod_tipo_scelta_contraente Code referring procedure choosing contractor tipo_scelta_contraente Description procedure selecting contractor cod_modalita_realizzazione Code referring mode implementation tender modalita_realizzazione Description mode implementation tender codice_ausa AUSA Code (code assigned ANAC (italian national anti-corruption authority), identifies Contracting Station .e. authority Unique Register Contracting Stations) cf_amministrazione_appaltante Fiscal Code Administration tenders purchases denominazione_amministrazione_appaltante Name administration issuing invitation tender purchase sezione_regionale Regional reference section data submission. id_centro_costo Identifier Cost Center, organizational unit contracting station. denominazione_centro_costo Cost Center Name anno_pubblicazione Reference year, extracted date publication mese_pubblicazione Reference month, extracted date publication cod_cpv Commodity category code purchased good service (CPV vocabulary) descrizione_cpv Description commodity category good service purchased flag_prevalente denotes whether commodity category prevailing (contract may include one category goods services) cup Unique Project Code, identifies public investment project id_categoria Identification code category works procured descrizione Description categories works descrizione_tipo_categoria Description type work category contract modalita_realizzazione_denominazione Name mode implementation contract tipo_scelta_contraente_denominazione name Contractor's Choice data_aggiudicazione_definitiva Date award, per minutes esito Description outcome award process (Awarded, Cancelled...) criterio_aggiudicazione Award criterion adopted (economically advantageous bid, lowest price, etc.) data_comunicazione_esito Date announcement outcome award. importo_aggiudicazione amount award ribasso_aggiudicazione Value rebate made Economic Operator awarded tender. flag_subappalto Indicator possibility subcontracting id_aggiudicazione Unique award code cod_esito Code identifying outcome award procedure asta_elettronica Indicator use electronic auction massimo_ribasso Maximum value discount charged minimo_ribasso Minimum value discount charged tender data reference date data block descrizione_evento Event Description (Auction Base, Variant...) importo_sicurezza Event Description (Auction Base, Variant...) dettaglio_evento Detail variation e.g. variant number importo_forniture Amount Supplies importo_lavori Amount Work importo_progettazione Design Amount somme_a_disposizione Amounts available importo_servizi Amount Services ulteriori_oneri_non_soggetti_ribasso Additional charges subject rebate ruolo Description participant's role. codice_fiscale Participant's tax code. denominazione Participant name. tipo_soggetto Type participating entity. cf_subappaltante Subcontractor Tax Code. data_autorizzazione Subcontracting authorization date oggetto Subject subcontracting. descrizione_categoria Description category works. cod_categoria Works category identification code. data_stipula_contratto Date entering contract data_esecutivita_contratto Contract execution date data_termine_contrattuale Contract termination date data_inizio_effettiva Actual start date work consegna_frazionata Fractional delivery indicator id_variante Unique variant identifier. motivo_variante Description reason variance. data_approvazione_variante Date approval variance. motivo_risoluzione Reason contract resolution motivo_interruzione_anticipata Description reason early termination data_conclusione_anticipata Date early termination contract data_effettiva_ultimazione Effective completion date contract
